arStrings.szText: Use {icon:l_horiz, 2} to adjust the black point to determine the maximum luminance that will appear black.
Use {icon:l_horiz, 2} to adjust the brightness slider until the logo is barely visible.
Use {icon:l_horiz, 2} to adjust the white point to determine the minimum luminance that will appear white.
Adjust the black point to maintain as much detail as possible in the left image. Adjust the white point to maintain as much detail as possible in the right image. Adjust brightness as necessary.
If enabled, target lock will remain active between encounters.
If enabled, the functions of the left and right sticks will be swapped.
When using lock target and your target dies, it will auto select a new one as long as a target remains.
Combine Move / Interact / Basic Skill Slot
Adjusts the speed of screen reader dictation.
Draws a highlight around the player.
Adjusts the volume of screen reader dictation.
Controls the color of your player highlight.
Controls the color of NPC highlights.
Controls the color of enemy highlights
Controls the color of interactable object highlights.
Adjusts the intensity of the color blindness filter.  Lowering this will reduce the strength of the color adjustments in the game.

Controls the dialog lines spoken by the player when error text appears on the screen.

{c_highlight}On:{/c} All dialog lines are spoken
{c_highlight}Off:{/c} No dialog lines are spoken
{c_highlight}Simple:{/c} An error noise is played in place of the dialog lines.
Change the bindings for this action.
Enables or disables text to speech for the Party channel.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} Allows for third party applications to handle screen reading and disables the platform's built in screen reader.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} Defaults to the platform's built in screen reader.
Toggles the Abilities side panel, which contains the Skill Tree and Paragon board.

Sets focus to the text chat input field.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}

Selects the next tab in chat when text chat is active.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}

Selects the previous tab in chat when text chat is active.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}
Activates the quick message menu for sending pre-written phrases.
Resets the fade timer on the text chat widow.
Toggles your class-specific mechanic screen if relevant.

When pressed:
{c_highlight}Move:{/c} If your cursor is over terrain, your character will move to that location.
{c_highlight}Interact:{/c} If your cursor is over a clickable object or non-playable character, your player will interact with that object or character.
{c_highlight}Basic Skill:{/c} If your cursor is over a target that can be attacked, your player will cast the ability assigned to your Basic Skill Slot.

Cycles through available chat targets when text chat is active.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}

Removes active focus from text chat.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}
Used to look at certain points of interest. Can also be used as a fallback key for interacting with objects and non-playable characters in the world.
Moves you to your cursor's location without attacking monsters or interacting with objects.
Toggles Framerate Display at the bottom left of the screen.

Toggles the Game Menu.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}
Allows the player to attack without moving.
Used to look at certain points of interest. Can also be used as a fallback key for interacting with objects and non-playable characters in the world.
Toggles speech to text transcription of your current voice channel. Only works when you are in an active voice channel.
Summons the player's mount if available.
Dismounts the player with a combat ability.
Moves the player to their cursor's location when pressed.
Scrolls text chat down by a page.
Scrolls text chat up by a page.
Casts the ability assigned to this slot.
Activates voice transmission when held if the player is in a voice channel.
Opens to your Journal within the Map screen.

Enables controls to respond to social requests from other players.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}
Sets the player who last whispered you as your current chat target.
Sets the player you last whispered as your current chat target.
Screen reader skips to the next content block.
Saves an image of your game screen to your local Documents folder.
Refreshes display of item labels on the ground.
Toggles the Skill Assignment flyout from your Action Bar.
Skips to the next text line.

When pressed:
{c_highlight}Interact:{/c} If your cursor is over a clickable object or non-playable character, your player will interact with that object or character.
{c_highlight}Basic Skill:{/c} If your cursor is over a target that can be attacked, your player will cast the ability assigned to your Basic Skill Slot.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} Movement, Interaction, and casting the ability assigned to your Basic Skill slot will utilize the same binding.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} You can define separate bindings for movement, interaction, and casting the ability assigned to your Basic Skill slot.
When engaged on a target, all offensive abilities will attempt to hit that target.
Casts Town Portal and returns you to the nearest discovered capital city.
Toggles between a zoomed in and zoomed out state.

Hides Real IDs and replaces character and account names with randomized versions. 

A hotkey to toggle the mode can be defined under the "Controls > System" section. In-game player reporting will still work regardless of the state of this option.

{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} Display real IDs, characters, and account names
{c_highlight}Hide my name:{/c} Obfuscate your own identifiers
{c_highlight}Hide other player names:{/c} Obfuscate the identifiers of other players
{c_highlight}Hide all names:{/c} Obfuscate all identifiers
Toggles the Character details and Inventory panel.
Uses the item or action bound to this position on the middle wheel.
Uses the item or action bound to this position on the left wheel.
Uses the item or action bound to this position on the right wheel.
Gives your mount a burst of speed.

{c_highlight}Hold:{/c} Activate Hold Position by keeping the Hold Position key pressed.
{c_highlight}Toggle:{/c} Press the Hold Position key to toggle the behavior on and off.
Displays text chat from a clan member over their head.
Displays text chat from a nearby player over their head.
Displays text chat from a party member over their head.
Displays text chat from a trade channel member over their head.

Toggles the Map screen.

{c_red}Cannot be rebound.{/c}

Zooms the in-game camera in or out when the mousewheel is scrolled up or down.

While enabled, mouse up and mouse down cannot be used as bindings.
When enabled game will render at lower resolution, based on selected setting, and will be upscaled to display resolution using temporal upscaling techniques.

Allows you to use the right stick to change your locked target.
{c_highlight}You will not be able to bind right stick to other actions while this is enabled.{/c}

Allows you to use the left stick to change your locked target.
{c_highlight}You will not be able to bind left stick to other actions while this is enabled.{/c}

Boosts frame rates by using AI to render additional frames.

This feature requires a GeForce RTX 40 Series graphics card and that "Hardware-accelerated GPU Scheduling" is enabled in Windows. It is compatible with the {c_highlight}Default{/c} and {c_highlight}NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution{/c} Resolution Scaling modes. Frame Generation will deactivate if the game is letterboxed.
Super Resolution boosts frame rates by rendering fewer pixels and using AI to output high resolution frames. This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.

Used to optimize system latency which increases PC responsiveness.

Enabling NVIDIA DLSS Frame Generation will force this option to {c_highlight}Enabled{/c}.
Enables or disables audio that describes text and interactive elements of the current screen.

{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Meant for achieving a stable framerate on lower end hardware.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Favors performance over visual quality.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} Attempts a balance between performance and visual quality.
{c_highlight}Ultra:{/c} Favors visual quality over performance.
{c_highlight}Custom:{/c} Set your own preferences.
Adjusts the image sharpness when using NVIDIA DLSS.
Adjusts the image sharpness when using AMD FSR.

Selects the resolution scaling technique to use, which can help improve performance and/or image quality.

{c_highlight}None:{/c} Uses temporal anti-aliasing and an adjustable resolution percentage.
{c_highlight}AMD FSR 1.0:{/c} A cutting-edge super-optimized spatial upscaling technology that produces impressive image quality at fast framerates.
{c_highlight}AMD FSR 2:{/c} A cutting-edge temporal upscaling algorithm that produces high resolution frames from lower resolution inputs.
{c_highlight}NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution:{/c} Boosts frame rates by rendering fewer pixels and using AI to output high resolution frames. This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.
{c_highlight}Intel XeSS:{/c} Uses machine learning to deliver higher performance with exceptional image quality.
Moves the player to their cursor's location or interacts with cursor targeted object.
command key can be used in place of control key; fn+left mouse button can be used in place of right mouse button
Allows you to change the primary display mode of the game to Windowed or Windowed (Fullscreen).
Display in widescreen aspect ratio regardless of screen resolution.
Higher resolution will result in increased clarity, but this greatly affects performance. Choose a resolution that matches the aspect ratio of your monitor.

Synchronizes your framerate to some fraction of your monitor's refresh rate. Enable this if you see excessive screen tearing in game.

Enabling NVIDIA DLSS Frame Generation will disable this option.

Determines the clarity and size of textures used throughout the game. Higher texture quality will result in more detail, but it requires more system memory (RAM) and video memory (VRAM).

{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Suitable for playing up to 720p resolution.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Suitable for playing up to 1080p resolution.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} Suitable for playing up to 4k resolution.
{c_highlight}Ultra:{/c} Recommended for playing at 4k resolution. Requires 32 GB of RAM for a smooth play experience.

Controls both the method and quality of shadows. Decreasing this may greatly improve performance.

{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Low-resolution terrain shadows, blob shadows for units.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Low-resolution terrain shadows, high-resolution dynamic shadows near player.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} High-resolution dynamic shadows for entire scene.
{c_highlight}Highest:{/c} High-resolution, highest quality dynamic shadows for entire scene.
Determines the realism of colliding objects and gravity. Physics Quality relies on your computer's processor (CPU).

Controls the density and the distance at which ground clutter items, like grass and foliage are placed. Decrease to improve performance.

{c_highlight}Off:{/c} No Clutter.
{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Short distance at which clutter items are placed with low density.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Medium distance at which clutter items are placed with medium density.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} High distance at which clutter items are placed with high density.
{c_highlight}Highest:{/c} High quality which also enables shadows from clutter.
Fullscreen anti-aliasing helps soften model edges. Disabling this may improve performance.
Adjusts the volume of all sound in the game.
Swap the sound coming from the left and right speakers.
Display quest dialog in chat bubbles during in-game scripted sequences.
Output all quest dialog to chat window.
Briefly display item label when the item drops on the ground.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} All tutorials will be shown.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} Only tutorials specific to new features in Diablo IV will be shown.
Auto-equips items if you have an empty Inventory slot for that item.
Prevents the user from picking up/dragging Skills on the action bar. This function can be bound to a key in the keybindings interface.
Display numerical health values on player health bars.
Display floating health numbers above characters, showing healing effects on player.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} All damage dealt by the player is displayed as floating numbers on screen.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} Hides all damage numbers.
Display floating numbers above monsters, showing critical damage dealt by the player.
Display floating numbers above monsters, showing blocks, parries, and dodges.
Show player health bars above characters.
Show monster health bars above monsters.
Reduces the number of rendered particle system effects. Checking this may greatly improve performance.
Toggles the display of the clock over the minimap.
Display advanced information on tooltips such as item property ranges, Lucky Hit chance on Skills, and indicators as to whether modifications are additive [+] or multiplicative [x].
Enable this option to limit and adjust the maximum framerate while running in the background.
Enable this option to limit and adjust the maximum framerate while running in the foreground.
Changing the language requires restarting the game. Are you sure you want to proceed?
Adjust the brightness slider until the logo is barely visible.
Displays a notification when a friend comes online.
Displays a notification when a friend goes offline.
Displays a notification when you receive a friend request.
Displays a notification when a friend earns a Challenge.
Display notifications in toast windows. If disabled, these messages will continue to be displayed in the chat window.
Adjust the duration of the toast window.
Select which currency type you would like to use for the Real Money Auction House.
Select which language you would like to use.
Allow friends to join your party without an invitation.
Adjust the behavior of the "Show Items on Ground" key binding when pressed.
Adjust the number of Sound Channels used.
Gamma is disabled while in this mode. Please switch to Fullscreen mode to enable Gamma.

Disable the operating system keyboard shortcuts.

{c_highlight}This option is always enabled in Fullscreen mode. For all other modes this option requires that "Enable access for assistive devices" is checked in the Universal Access preference pane in the System Preferences.{/c}
Use Command key as Control key
Use Command key and Control key interchangeably.
Command left click as right click
Hold down Command key and left click to simulate a right click.

The output device is where your sound will play.

Default will match your system's output device. Use this if you want to play the game through headphones or a different set of speakers.
Set this to match your speaker setup. Choose Stereo for headphones or standard two-speaker setups.
Displays a notification whenever an auction house event occurs.
Disables the confirmation dialog that appears when salvaging rare quality items.
Enable Display of Local Network Players

Allows you to see other players on your network who are currently online. These players will be displayed by their BattleTag. 

Disabling this feature prevents both you from seeing other players on your network and them from seeing you.
Only display the minimap when near an objective.
Allows the game to continue playing sound when it is not the focus window.
Controls the resolution of SSR. Decreasing this may improve performance.
Displays a notification when a clan member comes online.
Toggles whether or not cut scenes are automatically skipped while playing.

Disable the operating system keyboard shortcuts.

{c_highlight}This option is always enabled in Fullscreen mode. For all other modes this option requires you to grant access to "Diablo IV" in Security & Privacy preferences, located in System Preferences.{/c}
Automatically join voice chat in parties.
This output device is what your voice will play through.
This adjusts the volume of incoming voice chat.
This adjusts the outgoing volume of your own voice.
This output device is what incoming voice chat will play through. Default is your game sound output device.

{c_highlight}Push-to-Talk:{/c} Your voice only transmits when your push-to-talk key ({hotkey:VOICE_PTT}) is held down. This key can be adjusted under Controls.
{c_highlight}Open Mic:{/c} Automatically transmits voice when microphone sound is detected.
Controls both the method and quality of fog. Decreasing this may greatly improve performance.
Adjusts the rendering resolution of the 3D world. Default is 100%.
Show screen shake effects on certain Skills and abilities.
Adjusts all font sizing within the game.
Choose a configuration for your Life, Resource, and Skill bar.
Determines the number of samples used for anisotropic filtering.
Controls the number of samples used for SSAO. Decreasing this may improve performance.
Controls how many particles are spawned.
Controls the number of samples drawn for Anti-Aliasing.
Toggles whether dynamic shadows are rendered. Turning this off may increase performance.
Determines the size of the texture used to simulate water. Higher quality will result in more detail, but requires more video memory (VRAM).
Controls the quality of meshes and the distance at which they will lose additional detail. Decreasing this will increase performance.
Select the graphics processing unit (GPU) that you would like to use.
Displays the monitor Diablo IV is currently running on.

Allows for more detail in the lights and darks of the game visuals.

HDR is only available if your monitor supports it.
Controls whether screen space distortion is applied. Disabling this may improve performance.
Controls the quality of various visual effects on a case by case basis. Decreasing this may improve performance.

Determines the language of text in the game and subtitles.

{c_highlight}Can only be changed while on the character select screen. {/c}

Determines the language of speech audio.

{c_highlight}The available options are limited by what languages are currently installed. More languages can be installed from the Battle.net launcher settings. {/c}
Adjust the black point to determine the maximum luminance that will appear black.
Adjust the white point to determine the minimum luminance that will appear white.
Enable controller vibration effects on certain Skills and abilities.
Controls the quantity of reflection probes in the world. Lowering this will improve performance at the cost of reflection accuracy.
Are you sure you want to reset {s1} to default settings?
Enable real time ray-tracing. Requires hardware accelerated GPU for ray-tracing.

Determines the realism of ray-traced shadows. Relies on your computer's graphics processor(GPU). Lowering this setting will improve performance.

{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} No ray-traced shadows.
{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Ray-traced sun shadows only.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Ray-traced sun shadows and shadows cast by the player's light.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} Ray-traced shadows for all lights.

Determines the realism of ray-traced reflections. Relies on your computer's graphics processor(GPU). Lowering this setting will improve performance.

{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} No ray-traced reflections.
{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Single ray ray-traced reflections, with approximated blur from rough materials.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} Multi rays ray-traced reflections, giving accurate blur from rough materials.
NVIDIA DLSS uses AI to boost frame rates while maintaining great image quality and responsiveness. This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.
{c_red}DLSS can only be enabled if you have an RTX capable NVIDIA GPU{/c}
{c_red}Your GPU drivers are out of date, please update them to use DLSS. {/c}

When enabled, the game will render half as many pixels per frame and use data from previous frames to reconstruct a full resolution image. 

{c_highlight}Increases performance but may cause visual artifacts and lower image quality. {/c}

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} You will be able to text and voice chat with players on other platforms.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} You will no longer be able to text or voice chat with players on other platforms.
Adjusts the intensity of a sharpening filter on the final image.

Adjusts variable resolution threshold balancing image quality and responsiveness.

{c_highlight}Frame rate: {/c} Reduces rendering resolution when frame rate drops below 60 fps - targeting improved latency
{c_highlight}Image Quality: {/c} Improved image quality at the expense of frame rate
Displays the number of frames your monitor is currently displaying per second.
Adjusts the opacity of your chat window background when the window is active.
Local chat channel includes players near you within Sanctuary.
Trade chat channel is solely used for trading items.
Displays text chat from a player over their head.
This will enable hit flashes on characters while hitting a monster or player during combat.
Toggles lighting effects on connected peripherals.
This will disable several effects and lights in the game, reducing the amount of strobing in the game.
Voice Chat use is restricted for this user.
Sets the maximum frame rate the game will be rendered at. Does not affect visual quality, but lowering this can give a more stable framerate.
Draws a highlight around you when obscured from vision.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} When comparing item tooltips, properties gained, lost, and changes to equipped Skills will be displayed.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} When comparing item tooltips, only the primary stat will be compared.
{c_red}Your GPU drivers are out of date! Some features may not be available. Please exit the game and update them. {/c}
You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to discard them?
{c_highlight}Spatial Sound{/c} is supported, but it's based on your current platform. Enable this through your system's settings.
Toggles whether soft shadows are rendered. Turning this off will increase performance.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} Interact and casting your Basic Skill will utilize the same binding.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} You can define separate bindings for Interact and your Basic Skill slot.
Defines the type of voice heard when screen reader is enabled.
Adjust the extents of your screen space

The output device is where your sound will play.

Default will match your systems output device. Use this if you want to play the game through headphones or a different set of speakers.
Appends a timestamp to chat messages in the format of your choice.
System messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Trade channel messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Local area messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Error messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Combat warning messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Clan messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Clan officer messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Whispered messages will appear in this color in text chat.
Party messages will appear in this color in text chat.

Controls the level of quality of fur on player equipment, enemies, and the environment. Decrease to improve performance.

{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Lowest density of fur, some edge artifacts may be visible.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Medium density of fur, moderate visual quality.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} High density of fur, highest visual quality.
Modifier buttons cannot be bound by themselves

AXE ONLY
Enabling forces the game to run with emulated console quality settings.

{c_highlight}Hold All:{/c} Repeating or channeling Skills requires holding the Skill input.
{c_highlight}Toggle Channeled Skills:{/c} {c_important}Channeled{/c_important} Skills like Incinerate and Whirlwind can be toggled on and off. Repeated Skills require holding the Skill input.
{c_highlight}Toggle All:{/c} Repeating or channeling Skills can be toggled on and off.
Determines the cursor sensitivity on the user interface.
Changes the color of NPC Names displayed within subtitles.
Changes the color of World Locations displayed within subtitles.
Changes the color of the Player's Name displayed within subtitles.
Adjusts the font scaling for subtitles.
Adjusts the font color of the subtitles.

Adjusts the background opacity for subtitles.

{c_highlight}This does not apply to pre-rendered cinematics.{/c}
Inner Dead Zone increases the dead zone from the stick's neutral state out, making it take longer to start registering input.
Outer Dead Zone adds a new dead zone to stick inflection, effectively shorting an input curves present making players hit maximum inflection sooner.
Briefly display item label when the item drops on the ground.
Adjust the behavior of the "Show Items on Ground" key binding when pressed.

{c_highlight}Enabled:{/c} Cutscenes will progress automatically without requiring player interaction.
{c_highlight}Disabled:{/c} Certain cutscenes will pause after each line, requiring player input to continue. This feature may not apply to all cutscenes in the game.
Adjusts all cursor sizing within the game.
Defines the type of voice heard when text to speech is enabled.
Adjusts the speech volume of text to speech voice.
Play sound separating chat line breaks
Enables or disables a sound that plays separating chat line breaks.
Enables or disables the character name during text to speech.
Enables or disables the channel name during text to speech.
Enables or disables the item name during text to speech.
[PH] Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Enables or disables text to speech for the Local channel.
Enables or disables text to speech for the Trade channel.
Enables or disables text to speech for the Clan channel.
[PH] Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Enables or disables text to speech for the Whisper channel.
Enables sound effects tied to items dropping in the world.
Enables sound effects when an item or object in the world is targeted by the player.
Enables sound effects when an item in the world is nearby.
Apply this effect to items at this quality level or higher.

Apply this effect to all weapon items.

{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  1-Handed
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  2-Handed
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Offhands

Apply this effect to all armor items.

{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Helm
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Chest
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Gloves
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Pants
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Boots
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Shields

Apply this effect to all jewelry items.

{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Rings
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Amulets

Apply this effect to all socketable items.

{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Gems
{icon:AttributeBullet, 0.6}  Skulls
Apply this effect to all other item types not listed above.

Enables or disables all text to speech narration of in-game text chat.

{c_highlight}Supports English written text only.{/c}
Transcribe Voice Chat is not currently enabled. Would you like to enable it now?
Speech to text allows you to add closed captioning in a voice channel. Transcription started.
When enabled game will render at lower resolution, based on selected setting, and will be upscaled to display resolution using spatial upscaling techniques.
Show health bars above summoned minions.

Intel Xe Super Sampling (XeSS) technology uses machine learning to deliver more performance with exceptional image quality.

{c_highlight}Significantly improves performance at the cost of sharpness and image quality.{/c}

{c_highlight}Press and Hold:{/c} Use the Action Wheel by pressing and holding the Action Wheel key.
{c_highlight}Press to Toggle:{/c} Press the Action Wheel key to toggle the wheel on and off. Using the wheel does not require holding the key.

Applies a filter to compensate visuals for color blindness.

{c_highlight}Protanopia:{/c} Difficulty distinguishing red light from green light.
{c_highlight}Deuteranopia:{/c} Difficulty distinguishing green light from red light.
{c_highlight}Tritanopia:{/c} Difficulty distinguishing blue light from green light, and yellow light from red light.
Adjusts the amount of attenuation on game sounds when someone in your party is speaking in voice chat.
Attenuates game sounds when someone in your party is speaking in voice chat.
Controls the amount of detail used to render terrain meshes. Decreasing this will increase performance.
Configure the display mode for monster health bar.
Set this to match what type of output device you are listening on.
Do Not Sell or Share My Data
Plays a sound at the nearest usable traversal.
Moves the player in the direction they're facing/towards the cursor until interrupted
If Enabled, this will detect voice activity automatically based on the {c_highlight}Auto-Detect Sensitivity{/c} threshold.
This sets the threshold for microphone volume before voice will be detected.

Selects the quality mode for NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution.

{c_highlight}Ultra Performance:{/c} Offers the highest performance boost. Recommended for 8K gameplay only.
{c_highlight}Performance:{/c} Offers a higher performance boost than balanced mode.
{c_highlight}Balanced:{/c} Offers both optimized performance and image quality.
{c_highlight}Quality:{/c} Offers higher image quality than balanced mode.
{c_highlight}DLAA:{/c} Offers highest image quality.

Selects the quality mode for AMD FSR 2.

{c_highlight}Ultra Performance:{/c} Provides the highest performance gain while still maintaining an image quality representative of native rendering.
{c_highlight}Performance:{/c} Provides an image quality similar to native rendering with a major performance gain.
{c_highlight}Balanced:{/c} Offers an ideal compromise between image quality and performance gains.
{c_highlight}Quality:{/c} Provides an image quality equal or superior to native rendering with a significant performance gain.

Selects the quality mode for AMD FSR 1.0.

{c_highlight}Performance:{/c} Visibly impacts image quality and should only be selected in situations where needing additional performance is critical.
{c_highlight}Balanced:{/c} Produces a super resolution image approximating native rendering quality, with a major performance gain compared to native.
{c_highlight}Quality:{/c} Produces a super resolution image with quality representative of native rendering, with a sizeable performance gain.
{c_highlight}Ultra Quality:{/c} Produces an image with quality virtually indistinguishable from native rendering. It should be selected when the highest quality is desired.

Selects the quality mode for Intel XeSS.

{c_highlight}Performance:{/c} Improves overall gaming performance.
{c_highlight}Balanced:{/c} Delivers optimal performance and image quality.
{c_highlight}Quality:{/c} Delivers high quality visual upscale.
{c_highlight}Ultra Quality:{/c} Delivers the highest quality visual upscale.

{c_highlight}Display All:{/c} All damage and statuses caused by the player are displayed as floating numbers on screen.
{c_highlight}Hide Damage Numbers:{/c} Hides all damage numbers.
{c_highlight}Hide All:{/c} Hides all damage numbers and statuses
The Screen Reader is enabled by default. If you do not need this feature choose to disable it now.
Increases the contrast of colors used on the in-game cursors.
Chosen color is used to tint the in-game cursor.
Text Chat use is restricted for this user.

Toggles Streamer Mode in the Connect Settings On or Off. 

If you have not defined a Streamer Mode selection, this will toggle between "Disabled" and "Hide all names"

Determines the language of speech audio.

{c_highlight}Additional languages can be selected through the Diablo IV properties within Steam.{/c}
If checked, you will not try to move closer when trying to use a skill out of range on mouse

If {c_highlight}Enabled{/c_highlight}, evade actions will be performed in the current movement direction.

If {c_highlight}Disabled{/c_highlight}, evade actions will be performed in the direction of the cursor.
Controls the resolution used for GTAO. Decreasing this may improve performance.
If checked, your movement direction will be used to aim instead of the mouse cursor

Controls contact shadows on characters. Decrease to improve performance.

{c_highlight}Low:{/c} Contact shadows appear only on player characters.
{c_highlight}Medium:{/c} Contact shadows appear on players, town characters, and mounts.
{c_highlight}High:{/c} Contact shadows appear on players, town characters, mounts, and monsters.
Allows the player to save multiple hotkey configurations. Changing the config updates all bindings to the newly chosen save.
Moves the player in the up direction.
Moves the player in the down direction.
Moves the player in the left direction.
Moves the player in the right direction.
Enable ray-tracing against ground foliage. Disabling this setting will improve performance.

Enabled: Enhances some shadowing and reflections with ray tracing. Improves quality of other effects such as ground clutter, fur, and fog. Targets 30 fps.

Disabled: Prioritizes performance. Targets 60 fps.

Enabled: Improves quality of other effects such as ground clutter, fur, and fog. Targets 30 fps.

Disabled: Prioritizes performance. Targets 60 fps
